html.p: The visualization toolbox brings the power of Apache ECharts to Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud. This tutorial will walk you through the basics of using the toolbox.
html.div:
Getting started
If you have not worked with ECharts before you find examples here. You will be able to integrate every of the shown visualizations using your own data into Splunk. The example page also can be used as an IDE to customize your charts before bringing it to Splunk.
Create the first visualization
Let's open the very first example page. On the left side you see an option = "SomeJSON" string. This configures the visualization on the right. Try to play around with the data: attributes within the sections "xAxis" and "series".
Here is the basic skeleton for the custom visualization. Copy the code to <panel></panel> of your new dashboard.
<viz type="visualization_toolbox.hman"> <search> <query>| makeresults</query> <earliest>$earliest$</earliest> <latest>$latest$</latest> </search> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.dataType">Custom</option> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.option"> </option> <option name="height">300</option> <option name="refresh.display">progressbar</option> </viz>
In the next step copy your code from the ECharts example page within the visualization_toolbox.hman.option tag.
<viz type="visualization_toolbox.hman"> <search> <query>| makeresults</query> <earliest>$earliest$</earliest> <latest>$latest$</latest> </search> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.dataType">Custom</option> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.option">option = { xAxis: { type: 'category', data: ['Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat', 'Sun'] }, yAxis: { type: 'value' }, series: [ { data: [150, 230, 224, 218, 135, 147, 260], type: 'line' } ] }; </option> <option name="height">300</option> <option name="refresh.display">progressbar</option> </viz>
